newsitem.title: USA: Allstate Q1 life statutory premiums down.
newsitem.headline: Allstate Q1 life statutory premiums down.

text.p: Allstate Corp said statutory premiums for its life and annuity business fell 15.1 percent in the first quarter as lower sales of group pension products more than offset higher sales of individual annnuities.
Excluding group pension sales, statutory premiums, which include all premiums and deposits, grew 7.2 percent.
Operating income fell 3.2 percent, as increased expenses related to deferred policy acquisition costs more than offset growth in investments and favorable mortality margins.

Revenues determined under generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP) increased 16.1 percent, boosted by higher realized capital gains and increases in sales of traditional life insurance and life contingent annuities.
Realized capital gains increased to $49 million from nil, primarily due to trading activity.
Net income rose 48.9 percent to $140 million, reflecting increased realized capital gains.
